trans-unit.source: Store you .NET backend project code in source control | Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Store you .NET backend project code in source control | Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to store your .NET backend project in and publish from a local Git repo on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to store your .NET backend project in and publish from a local Git repo on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Store your mobile service project code in source control
trans-unit.target: Store your mobile service project code in source control

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: [.NET backend](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-store-code-source-control.md)
trans-unit.target: [.NET backend](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-store-code-source-control.md)

trans-unit.source: [Javascript backend](mobile-services-store-scripts-source-control.md)
trans-unit.target: [Javascript backend](mobile-services-store-scripts-source-control.md)

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use the source control provided by Azure Mobile Services to store your .NET backend service project.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use the source control provided by Azure Mobile Services to store your .NET backend service project.

trans-unit.source: Your project can be published by simply uploading from your local Git repository to your production mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Your project can be published by simply uploading from your local Git repository to your production mobile service.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you must have already created a mobile service by completing either the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you must have already created a mobile service by completing either the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Enable source control in your mobile service
trans-unit.target: Enable source control in your mobile service

trans-unit.source: Install Git and create the local repository
trans-unit.target: Install Git and create the local repository

trans-unit.source: Install Git on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: Install Git on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: The steps required to install Git vary between operating systems.
trans-unit.target: The steps required to install Git vary between operating systems.

trans-unit.source: See [Installing Git] for operating system specific distributions and installation guidance.
trans-unit.target: See [Installing Git] for operating system specific distributions and installation guidance.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] On some operating systems, both a command-line and GUI version of Git are available.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] On some operating systems, both a command-line and GUI version of Git are available.

trans-unit.source: The instructions provided in this article use the command-line version.
trans-unit.target: The instructions provided in this article use the command-line version.

trans-unit.source: Open a command-line, such as **GitBash** (Windows) or **Bash** (Unix Shell).
trans-unit.target: Open a command-line, such as **GitBash** (Windows) or **Bash** (Unix Shell).

trans-unit.source: On OS X systems you can access the command-line through the **Terminal** application.
trans-unit.target: On OS X systems you can access the command-line through the **Terminal** application.

trans-unit.source: From the command line, change to the directory where you will store your scripts.
trans-unit.target: From the command line, change to the directory where you will store your scripts.

trans-unit.source: For example, `cd SourceControl`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `cd SourceControl`.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a local copy of your new Git repository, replacing `<your_git_URL>` with the URL of the Git repository for your mobile service:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a local copy of your new Git repository, replacing `<your_git_URL>` with the URL of the Git repository for your mobile service:

trans-unit.source: When prompted, type in the user name and password that you set when you enabled source control in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, type in the user name and password that you set when you enabled source control in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: After successful authentication, you will see a series of responses like this:
trans-unit.target: After successful authentication, you will see a series of responses like this:

trans-unit.source: Browse to the directory from which you ran the `git clone` command, and notice that a new directory is created with the name of the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the directory from which you ran the `git clone` command, and notice that a new directory is created with the name of the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: For a .NET backend mobile service, the git repository is initial empty.
trans-unit.target: For a .NET backend mobile service, the git repository is initial empty.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created your local repository, you can publish your .NET backend service project from this repository.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created your local repository, you can publish your .NET backend service project from this repository.

trans-unit.source: Publish your project by using Git
trans-unit.target: Publish your project by using Git

trans-unit.source: Create a new .NET backend mobile service project in Visual Studio 2013, or move an existing project into your new local repository.
trans-unit.target: Create a new .NET backend mobile service project in Visual Studio 2013, or move an existing project into your new local repository.

trans-unit.source: For a quick test, download and save the Mobile Services quickstart project to this folder.
trans-unit.target: For a quick test, download and save the Mobile Services quickstart project to this folder.

trans-unit.source: Remove any NuGet package folders, leaving the packages.config file.
trans-unit.target: Remove any NuGet package folders, leaving the packages.config file.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services will automatically restore your NuGet packages based on the packages.confign file.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services will automatically restore your NuGet packages based on the packages.confign file.

trans-unit.source: You can also define a .gitignore file to prevent the package directories from being added.
trans-unit.target: You can also define a .gitignore file to prevent the package directories from being added.

trans-unit.source: In the Git command prompt, type the following command to start tracking the new script file:
trans-unit.target: In the Git command prompt, type the following command to start tracking the new script file:

trans-unit.source: Type the following command to commit changes:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command to commit changes:

trans-unit.source: Type the following command to upload the changes to the remote repository, and supply your credentials:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command to upload the changes to the remote repository, and supply your credentials:

trans-unit.source: You should see a series of commands that indicates that the project is deployed to Mobile Services, packages are added, and the service is restarted.
trans-unit.target: You should see a series of commands that indicates that the project is deployed to Mobile Services, packages are added, and the service is restarted.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the URL of your .NET backend mobile service, and you should see the following:
trans-unit.target: Browse to the URL of your .NET backend mobile service, and you should see the following:

trans-unit.source: ![Mobile Services startup page](./media/mobile-services-dotnet-backend-store-code-source-control/mobile-service-startup.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Mobile Services startup page](./media/mobile-services-dotnet-backend-store-code-source-control/mobile-service-startup.png)

trans-unit.source: Now, your mobile service project is maintained in source control, and you can publish service updates by simply pushing updates from your local repository.
trans-unit.target: Now, your mobile service project is maintained in source control, and you can publish service updates by simply pushing updates from your local repository.

trans-unit.source: For information about making data model changes in a .NET backend mobile service that uses a SQL Database, see [How to make data model changes to a .NET backend mobile service].
trans-unit.target: For information about making data model changes in a .NET backend mobile service that uses a SQL Database, see [How to make data model changes to a .NET backend mobile service].
